com.microsoft.azure.eventhubs

Class ConnectionStringBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.eventhubs.ConnectionStringBuilder

  • public class ConnectionStringBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    ConnectionStringBuilder can be used to construct a connection string which can establish communication with ServiceBus entities. It can also be used to perform basic validation on an existing connection string.

    Sample Code: 

    
 	ConnectionStringBuilder connectionStringBuilder = new ConnectionStringBuilder(
     "ServiceBusNamespaceName",
     "ServiceBusEntityName", // eventHubName or QueueName or TopicName
     "SharedAccessSignatureKeyName",
     "SharedAccessSignatureKey");

 String connectionString = connectionStringBuilder.toString();

    A connection string is basically a string consisted of key-value pair separated by ";". Basic format is {<key>=<value>[;<key>=<value>]} where supported key name are as follow:

    • Endpoint - the URL that contains the servicebus namespace
    • EntityPath - the path to the service bus entity (queue/topic/eventhub/subscription/consumergroup/partition)
    • SharedAccessKeyName - the key name to the corresponding shared access policy rule for the namespace, or entity.
    • SharedAccessKey - the key for the corresponding shared access policy rule of the namespace or entity.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionStringBuilder(java.lang.String connectionString)
      ConnectionString format: Endpoint=sb://namespace_DNS_Name;EntityPath=EVENT_HUB_NAME;SharedAccessKeyName=SHARED_ACCESS_KEY_NAME;SharedAccessKey=SHARED_ACCESS_KEY

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionStringBuilder

        public ConnectionStringBuilder(java.lang.String namespaceName,
                               java.lang.String entityPath,
                               java.lang.String sharedAccessKeyName,
                               java.lang.String sharedAccessKey)
        Build a connection string consumable by EventHubClient.createFromConnectionString(String)
        Parameters:
        namespaceName - Namespace name (dns suffix - ex: .servicebus.windows.net is not required)
        entityPath - Entity path. For eventHubs case specify - eventHub name.
        sharedAccessKeyName - Shared Access Key name
        sharedAccessKey - Shared Access Key

      • ConnectionStringBuilder

        public ConnectionStringBuilder(java.net.URI endpointAddress,
                               java.lang.String entityPath,
                               java.lang.String sharedAccessKeyName,
                               java.lang.String sharedAccessKey)
        Build a connection string consumable by EventHubClient.createFromConnectionString(String)
        Parameters:
        endpointAddress - namespace level endpoint. This needs to be in the format of scheme://fullyQualifiedServiceBusNamespaceEndpointName
        entityPath - Entity path. For eventHubs case specify - eventHub name.
        sharedAccessKeyName - Shared Access Key name
        sharedAccessKey - Shared Access Key

      • ConnectionStringBuilder

        public ConnectionStringBuilder(java.net.URI endpointAddress,
                               java.lang.String entityPath,
                               java.lang.String sharedAccessSignature)
        Build a connection string consumable by EventHubClient.createFromConnectionString(String)
        Parameters:
        endpointAddress - namespace level endpoint. This needs to be in the format of scheme://fullyQualifiedServiceBusNamespaceEndpointName
        entityPath - Entity path. For eventHubs case specify - eventHub name.
        sharedAccessSignature - Shared Access Signature

      • ConnectionStringBuilder

        public ConnectionStringBuilder(java.lang.String connectionString)
        ConnectionString format: Endpoint=sb://namespace_DNS_Name;EntityPath=EVENT_HUB_NAME;SharedAccessKeyName=SHARED_ACCESS_KEY_NAME;SharedAccessKey=SHARED_ACCESS_KEY
        Parameters:
        connectionString - ServiceBus ConnectionString
        Throws:
        IllegalConnectionStringFormatException - when the format of the ConnectionString is not valid

      • getOperationTimeout

        public java.time.Duration getOperationTimeout()
        OperationTimeout is applied in erroneous situations to notify the caller about the relevant EventHubException
        Returns:
        operationTimeout

      • setOperationTimeout

        public void setOperationTimeout(java.time.Duration operationTimeout)
        Set the OperationTimeout value in the Connection String. This value will be used by all operations which uses this ConnectionStringBuilder, unless explicitly over-ridden.

        ConnectionString with operationTimeout is not inter-operable between java and clients in other platforms.

        Parameters:
        operationTimeout - Operation Timeout

      • getRetryPolicy

        @Deprecated
public RetryPolicy getRetryPolicy()
        Deprecated. 
        Get the retry policy instance that was created as part of this builder's creation.
        Returns:
        RetryPolicy applied for any operation performed using this ConnectionString

      • setRetryPolicy

        @Deprecated
public void setRetryPolicy(RetryPolicy retryPolicy)
        Deprecated. 
        Set the retry policy.

        RetryPolicy is not inter-operable with ServiceBus clients in other platforms.

        Parameters:
        retryPolicy - RetryPolicy applied for any operation performed using this ConnectionString

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns an inter-operable connection string that can be used to connect to ServiceBus Namespace
        Overrides:

        Returns:
